subject: Re: [junit] Testing Swing UI without waiting for AWT queue
msgSnippet: Consider carefully what you are testing.  Are you testing whether your login thread is terminating, or whether the login dialog is hidden?  Of course, if
messageBody:
Consider carefully what you are testing. Are you testing whether your
login thread is terminating, or whether the login dialog is hidden? Of
course, if you're simply trying to synchronize the test with the other
thread, you would ideally wait for an explicit flag that indicates
"login is complete".

Here's an example waiting for the dialog to close (using the abbot
extension to JUnit for handling UI components, using a
ComponentTestFixture):

// do whatever you do to launch your app, launching a separate thread
if necessary
// Find the login dialog
Dialog d = (Dialog)getFinder().find(new Matcher() {
public boolean matches(Component c) {
// do whatever tests you need to determine if this is the
dialog you want
return c instanceof Dialog && ((Dialog)c).isModal();
}
};
while (d.isShowing()) {
Thread.sleep(10);
}
// The dialog has now been closed; continue with the test
